install_guide_markdown:
# PCLinuxOS 2024 Installation Guide

## Prerequisites
- 1 GB RAM minimum (2 GB recommended)
- 15 GB free disk space
- USB drive (4 GB+) for bootable media
- Internet connection recommended

## Step 1: Download and Verify ISO
Download from official PCLinuxOS mirrors.

## Step 2: Create Bootable USB
Use tools like Rufus (Windows), Etcher (cross-platform), or dd (Linux).

## Step 3: Boot from USB
Restart computer and access boot menu.

## Step 4: Install PCLinuxOS
Follow graphical installer from the live environment.

## Step 5: Post-Installation
Use Synaptic Package Manager to install additional software. Explore MyLiveCD tool to create custom live USBs.

install_steps.title: Download PCLinuxOS ISO
install_steps.detail_md:
Download PCLinuxOS 2024 from the official website. Choose your preferred desktop:

**KDE Edition**: 2.8 GB  
**MATE Edition**: 2.2 GB  
**XFCE Edition**: Available from community repos

PCLinuxOS is a rolling release distribution known for ease of use.

install_steps.title: Verify ISO Checksum
install_steps.detail_md: Verify the downloaded ISO using SHA256 checksum to ensure file integrity.

install_steps.title: Create Bootable USB Drive
install_steps.detail_md:
Use a USB drive (4 GB or larger) to create bootable installation media.

**WARNING**: This will erase all data on the USB drive.

install_steps.title: Boot from USB Drive
install_steps.detail_md:
Insert USB drive and restart your computer. Access boot menu to select USB drive.

PCLinuxOS boots into a full live environment.

install_steps.title: Install PCLinuxOS
install_steps.detail_md:
From the live desktop, launch the PCLinuxOS installer.

Follow the installer prompts:
- Select language
- Configure disk partitions
- Set timezone and keyboard
- Create user account
- Install bootloader

install_steps.title: Explore Synaptic Package Manager
install_steps.detail_md:
PCLinuxOS uses APT/RPM hybrid with Synaptic Package Manager for easy software installation.

Access extensive package repository for additional software.

description: PCLinuxOS is a user-friendly rolling release distribution with excellent hardware detection. It uses APT package management and is known for its polished desktop experience.
long_description: PCLinuxOS is an independent rolling release distribution that originated as a Mandrake Linux fork. It's designed to be very user-friendly while maintaining a rolling release model, providing cutting-edge software without the need for major version upgrades. PCLinuxOS uses the APT package manager (adapted from Debian) combined with RPM packages, offering a vast software repository. The distribution is famous for its excellent hardware detection and out-of-the-box functionality. It features the MyLiveCD tool, which allows users to create their own customized live USB/CD versions of their installed system. The default desktop is KDE Plasma, but MATE and XFCE editions are also available. PCLinuxOS has a strong community focus with active forums and maintains a balance between stability and up-to-date software.
